Class Piece

  • java.lang.Object
    • Piece
  • public final class Piece
extends Object
    An immutable representation of a tetris piece in a particular rotation. Each piece is defined by the blocks that make up its body. See the lab document for an overview.
    Version:
    1.0, Mar 1, 2001
    Author:
    Nick Parlante

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      boolean equals​(Object other)
      Returns true if two pieces are the same -- their bodies contain the same points.
      Point[] getBody()
      Returns a reference to this piece's body.
      int getHeight()
      Returns the height of the piece measured in blocks.
      static Piece[] getPieces()
      Returns an array containing the first rotation of each of the 7 standard tetris pieces.
      int[] getSkirt()
      Returns a reference to this piece's skirt.
      int getWidth()
      Returns the width of the piece measured in blocks.
      Piece nextRotation()
      Returns a reference to a Piece that is 90 degrees counter-clockwise rotated from this Piece.

        clone, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Method Detail

      • getWidth

        public int getWidth()
        Returns the width of the piece measured in blocks.
        Returns:
        the width of the piece measured in blocks

      • getHeight

        public int getHeight()
        Returns the height of the piece measured in blocks.
        Returns:
        the height of the piece measured in blocks

      • getBody

        public Point[] getBody()
        Returns a reference to this piece's body. The caller should not modify this array.
        Returns:
        a reference to this piece's body

      • getSkirt

        public int[] getSkirt()
        Returns a reference to this piece's skirt. For each x value across the piece, the skirt gives the lowest y value in the body. This useful for computing where the piece will land. The caller should not modify this array.
        Returns:
        a reference to this piece's skirt

      • nextRotation

        public Piece nextRotation()
        Returns a reference to a Piece that is 90 degrees counter-clockwise rotated from this Piece. Implementation: The Piece class pre-computes all the rotations once. This method just hops from one pre-computed rotation to the next in constant time.
        Returns:
        a reference to a Piece that is 90 degrees counter-clockwise rotated from this Piece

      • equals

        public boolean equals​(Object other)
        Returns true if two pieces are the same -- their bodies contain the same points. Interestingly, this is not the same as having exactly the same body arrays, since the points may not be in the same order in the bodies. Used internally to detect if two rotations are effectively the same.
        Overrides:
        equals in class Object
        Parameters:
        other - the object with which to test equality
        Returns:
        true if two pieces are the same

      • getPieces

        public static Piece[] getPieces()
        Returns an array containing the first rotation of each of the 7 standard tetris pieces. The next (counterclockwise) rotation can be obtained from each piece with the nextRotation() method. In this way, the client can iterate through all the rotations until eventually getting back to the first rotation.
        Returns:
        an array containing the first rotation of each of the 7 standard tetris pieces
